meanings.definition: To separate or isolate a group based on race or ethnicity.
meanings.sent1: The school district's decision to resegregate students by race caused controversy.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood slowly resegregates as people of different races move away.
meanings.sent3: The picnic resegregates when the kids split into teams for a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The new policy threatens to resegregate the community, undoing years of progress.
meanings.sent5: The wall in the playground seems to resegregate the children into two groups.

meanings.definition: To divide or segregate again based on certain characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The company's restructuring plan resegregates employees based on their skills.
meanings.sent2: The city's zoning laws unintentionally resegregate the population by income.
meanings.sent3: The game of musical chairs resegregates the players each time the music stops.
meanings.sent4: The new seating arrangement in the cafeteria resegregates friends into different tables.
meanings.sent5: The color-coding system resegregates the books on the shelves for easier access.
